title: Thunderbird 136 Addon Compatibility
creator: electricdesert
content:
Hi team,

I tried switching over to the monthly release branch however none of my addons work.

Is there some major incompatibility introduced (aka WebExtensions)? I can not find any documentation anywhere as to what changed or why an extension would not work with 129+.

Also the release notes do not mention that 136 changes the Profile format, requiring a redownload of all messages from the server and therefore reindexing. This took several hours, only to find the addons don't work. Downgrading Thunderbird gives a profile error, and requires the `--allow-downgrade`switch to restore functionality. There should be a warning in the release notes regarding the one-way nature of the upgrade.

Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/thunderbird-128-nebula-faq"]

title: Email Interface
creator: Jack175
content:
My boss's Thunderbird email presentation appears far cleaner than mine, with a completely different interface despite us being on the same version of the application.

Can someone please help me transition? Screenshots attached.

content: After update inbox only has msgs from before Dec 2024. msgs in my assigned folders are up to date. when I clicked on the widget to download msgs, it said two were downloaded but no new msgs were in the inbox.

title: presentation of the list of emails in INBOX
creator: pegger2
content: Currently my incoming emails are listed (grouped) in subject (topic) order in the inbox. I would like to have them listed in time of arrival order. Is this possible? If yes, is there a simple setting that a user can access to switch from topic order to time based order? If no, is there any way this variation in presentation can be achieved? Thanks for reading and considering my request, Peter.

title: Thunderbird will not reinstall in my win 11 computer
creator: walter136
content: I recently bought a new computer and Installed Thunderbird. It worked fine. Then one day it would not start up, i got a message that a copy of Thunderbird is running and I should close it. I clicked the close button and the same message kept reappearing. It never could close. I tried uninstalling Thunderbird, it would not install and I kept getting the same message. How can I fix this and install a new copy of Thunderbird? Do I have to erase some registry?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/134.0.0.0;ff_version:same problem with firefox;os:win 11

title: Saving emails as .eml files, and creating folders
creator: Art74
content:
I've created the email account, and it can send and receive emails ok. In FiltaQuilla, I have checked "Save message as file." On the screen that shows my incoming emails, I have right-clicked on the account, I click on New Folder, and I created "Sales." So, Sales shows under the main entry, but there is not a physical folder named Sales. Under Tools / Message Filters, I have it set to move to Sales under the main entry.

When the mail is received, it is moved to Sales. But... There is a file named "Sales" (which I assume contains all of the Sales emails), but there is not a physical folder. And I cannot find .eml files.

What am I leaving out?

(You'll notice in the attached screen shot that I have changed the default location.) 

       Thank you.          Art Lieberman

title: 新　という受信メールのタグは何でしょうか / What is the tag for the received email "New"?
creator: shitama
content:
受信メールのタイトルの先頭に 自動的に「新」という文字が付く原因を教えてください。 新しく受信したメールでもこの「新」が付く場合と付かない場合があります。

Translated

Please tell me why the word "New" is automatically added to the beginning of the subject line of **received** emails. Even with newly received emails, this word "New" may or may not be added.

title: Global Search - Missing mails
creator: marcthibor
content:
Hi,

By chance I observed that some mails don't show up in the search results of global search. In my example these seams to be some mails from the send folder.

I already re-created the index and downloaded all mails again, without success. I clound't identify what is different to these mails.

Any sugestions?

Thanks marc

title: Cyrillic symbols damage in Thunderbird 136.0
creator: solarscream88
content:
Damage of all cyrillic symbols in subfolders' (not folders'!) names occurs after update from the latest minor version 128.x.x to 136.0.

The names of subfolders in Russian (marked in a large red rectangle) are damaged now. However, their names in the upper right zone (marked in a small red rectangle) near message count are shown correctly in Cyrillic (Russian)...

Notes: 1 - Subfolder names are broken (see the 1st screenshot). 2 - Folder names are good (see the 2nd screenshot). 3 - Some zones are faded by me in case of privacy.

How to fix it?

title: İletilerin alınması ve mail gönderme
creator: oguzhanagyurek
content: Selamlar, Firmamızda yıllardır thunderbird kullanıyoruz. Dün öğleden sonra birden mail alma ve mail gönderme durdu. İşlem yapamıyoruz. Ne mail alabiliyoruz ne de mail atabiliyoruz. Aynı ayarlar ile outlook a kurulum yaptığımdaysa mail alma veya atmada problem yaşamadığımızı gördüm. Dün birden yaşanan problemle alakalı yardım talep ediyoruz. Ayarlarda vs hiçbir değişiklik yapmadık, birden oluştu problem, ve 2 bilgisayarda aynı anda problem verdi.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird
creator: koenig.alexandra
content:
Dear Madam/Sir,

I have a problem with Thunderbird.

I receipt Emails and can login for view the emails, but I cannot send emails. There comes an field with information that the email could not send and to give in the password/a new password. "Anmeldung auf dem Server mail.gmx.net mit Benutzernamen "koenig.alexandra@gmx.net" fehlgeschlagen"

I do not understand what is the matter and I need your help. Because I do not need why I must give in a password for the Server. Also I do not know if I have a password therefore.

Is it possible that it is so because I had no connection from November until February and have reboot my rooter.

Please help me.

Best regards, Alexandra König
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: I can't send mail from one of my addresses
creator: clian64
content: I have a number of mail-accounts through one.com that I’ve get access to through Thunderbird. Now I can’t send messages from my primary account. The system tells me that it’s the wrong password, but I’ve updated the passwords without luck. I even tried to delete the account and add it again, but it won’t work. I can receive messages, but not send… There’s no problem sending from the other addresses so what’s the problem? Now I need to open my webmail every time I want to reply to or send a message, which is quite tiresome.

creator: krogholt8
content: I want to move certain old emails to a specific folder. I type the name of the person in the top bar (see: attached file no. 1). The email address of the person appears under "Message Mentioning". I click on the email address, which opens a new window (see file no. 2). I now want to be able to move all messages from the person in question to a specific folder. Therefore, I click on "Show result as List" (to then be able to open "Create filter from"). But when I click on "show result ...", I just see a blank page (Message not found) (see file no. 3). Am I doing something wrong? Thanks for the help!

title: Signed but not encrypted messages are marked "invalid digital signature"
creator: thunderbird42
content:
When receiving signed but not encrypted messages, thunderbird complains with "invalid digital signature" and "technical error deteced". Unpacking the message and checking with gpg manualy verifies the signature correctly. Messages encrypted and signed are verified correctly. When looking at the logs in the console, I can see:

<< ----

openpgp: Parsed contentTypeLine: multipart/signed; micalg=pgp-sha256; protocol="application/pgp-signature"; boundary="------------95ynGFLP1eI6rMalg5HH0Iop" mimeVerify.sys.mjs:133:14 openpgp: Decrypting message: -----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----- ..[snipped]

END PGP SIGNATURE-----

decryption.sys.mjs:143:14 openpgp: Nothing to decrypt/verify. decryption.sys.mjs:176:16 openpgp: Decrypting message: -----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----- ..[snipped]

END PGP SIGNATURE-----

decryption.sys.mjs:143:14 openpgp: Nothing to decrypt/verify. decryption.sys.mjs:176:16 openpgp: Parsed contentTypeLine: multipart/signed; micalg=pgp-sha256; protocol="application/pgp-signature"; boundary="------------95ynGFLP1eI6rMalg5HH0Iop" mimeVerify.sys.mjs:133:14 openpgp: Found signed MIME message; micalg=pgp-sha256 mimeVerify.sys.mjs:148:16 openpgp: Parsed contentTypeLine: multipart/signed; micalg=pgp-sha256; protocol="application/pgp-signature"; boundary="------------95ynGFLP1eI6rMalg5HH0Iop" mimeVerify.sys.mjs:133:14 openpgp: Found signed MIME message; micalg=pgp-sha256

>>----

Does simply singing without encryption require some special settings?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/digitally-signing-and-encrypting-messages"]

title: Can see e-mails in local Inbox in Thunderbird but when I try to read them they're all blank.
creator: scrappydoo
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 115.11.1

I've been using Thunderbird for over 20 years and my local inbox has many important e-mails going back to around 2008.

I backup my Thunderbird profile and e-mails etc on a weekly basis by just copying and pasting these folders and files to another HDD.

Over the last 2 weeks I tried to read some e-mails from 2008 and 2010 in my local inbox.

I can see the e-mails, who its from, subject, date, size etc.

But when I click on an e-mail Thunderbird opens it but I just get a white blank page with no e-mail address, no date, no subject line etc.

Then in the local Inbox when I scroll down and click on the others the same thing happens.

Thats very very annoying.

When click on the local Inbox folder and hit the repair button, all the e-mails suddenly vanish but the total file size of those e-mails in the local inbox is still there.

After that when I delete the Inbox.msp file and restart Thunderbird I still can't see any e-mails in my Local inbox.

Apart from this I can see and read e-mails in all other local folders even from 22 years ago.

I can also see and read e-mails in drafts, templates and sent boxes.

But I can't see and read e-mails in my local Inbox due to the above reasons.

Out of desperation I even upgraded to Thunderbird 128 to see if this would fix things but sadly it didnt.

Can some one please help or guide me on how to fix this Local Inbox problem.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: Enlarge font size conversations plugin message display
creator: lenberman
content:
I can't control the font size in messages displayed in conversations on the main display. Ctl-Shift-+ enlarges the space allocated to each conversation but doesn't change the font size. In a separate conversation window, things seem to be OK. T-bird 128.8.0esr (64-bit) : Conversations 4.2.4

Thanks for your help. --Len

title: Why are some jpg images slow to display ?
creator: Mike109
content:
I recently received email from two different sources & their large jpg images take a long time to load/open. One email contained an 11MB image & the other an 18MB image.

Yet there is no problem opening a 12MB or 19MB image from email I still have from a few months ago.

To my knowledge they all came from cell phones. The 12, 18, 19 from iPhones and not sure about the 11MB.

Usually I have no problem so I'm not sure what's going on with those two new jpgs.

Any suggestions to what the problem is? Thanks.

Aanmelden bij server is niet mogelijk. Waarschijnlijk een onjuiste configuratie, gebruikersnaam of wachtwoord.

Ik heb de inloggegevens van alle accounts buiten Thunderbird om gecontroleerd op gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord en deze zijn alle correct. Ik heb Thunderbird uitgezonderd van mijn firewall. title: Notifications won't stay
creator: LaffyinVegas
content:
Windows Live Mail finally stopped working for me. I tied both gmail desktop notifications and Outlook and kept having the same problem: I'd get a pop-up for 3 seconds saying I had an email in another account and then it would disappear. There was no record of it in "Notifications" like there was for WLM.....so, if I didn't see it pop up, I'd never know.....which takes away the main purpose of having it.

So, I decided to try Thunderbird and get the same problem. A very brief pop-up saying I got an email and then it vanished....with no record. So, if I was in the kitchen or bathroom, I'd never know about it.

Any suggestions?
